New Records: Aaron Civale threw seven shutout innings, his longest outing since last July 25 (eight innings vs. Kansas City with Cleveland) and his longest scoreless outing since last July 7 (also vs. Kansas City)
Key Match Events: Garrett Mitchell homered and rookie Jackson Chourio doubled in a pair of runs
Willy Adames broke for second base, and as he engaged himself in a brief rundown, Contreras broke for home from third
LaMonte Wade Jr. threw from first to third, but Matt Chapman dropped the ball in his haste to turn and throw to the plate, and Contreras was credited with a steal of home
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Civale is in a groove, which is great news for the Milwaukee Brewers
The Brewers, meanwhile, improved to 77-56 with a four-game series beginning Friday morning (first game of a doubleheader) at Cincinnati
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Ashby retired all six batters he faced over the final two innings, striking out three, to cap what was a terrific overall pitching performance by the Brewers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers game starts at 1:10 p.m. Thursday
TV: Bally Sports Wisconsin. Radio: AM-620 and a state network
